intro: Tylophora crebriflora, commonly known as the many-flowered tylophora, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
